div.p: Your Reverence (reverend father), I send back everything with the venerable brother Mr. Julius, who is setting out for France; you will hear the reason for his journey from him personally. Mr. Vergerius is still with us, and as far as I understand, he will remain here for several weeks; for he cannot or does not wish to leave before the arrival of Mr. Coignetius, so that he can handle the common affairs of Rhaetia together with him.
I am expecting more certain news from France; but in the meantime, the adversaries are strengthening themselves. But let the will of the Lord be done.
Regarding the council, I will omit no diligence, especially at our fairs, I will make an effort to have some certainty.
Indeed, I have entrusted this business to several people.

I am sending the letters of Mr. Traversius, from which you will understand that nothing has yet been accomplished; there is no need to return the letters, just destroy them. I am now entirely occupied with sermons and other business related to the upcoming market; therefore, I cannot write more, nor do I have anything else to write. I am most grateful to you for sharing the letters of such great men.
